steps.title: What is Canvas?
steps.content:
HTML5 Canvas is a drawing surface where you can create graphics programmatically using JavaScript.

Canvas vs Traditional UI:

HTML elements: Text, buttons, boxes (limited, rigid)
Canvas: Pixels, lines, curves, animations (unlimited, flexible)

Perfect for: Charts, maps, games, real-time visualizations

Why Canvas for our game?

  • Plot price movements as lines
  • Draw galaxy maps with hundreds of stars
  • Show supply/demand as heatmaps
  • Render player positions in real-time

steps.title: Canvas Basics
steps.content:
Create a canvas element in HTML:

<canvas id="myCanvas" width="800" height="600"> Your browser doesn't support Canvas </canvas>

Draw on canvas with JavaScript:

// Get the canvas element const canvas = document.getElementById('myCanvas'); const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d'); // Draw a rectangle (x, y, width, height) ctx.fillStyle = '#FF0000'; // Red color ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 100, 50); // Draw a circle ctx.fillStyle = '#00FF00'; // Green color ctx.beginPath(); ctx.arc(200, 200, 50, 0, Math.PI * 2); ctx.fill(); // Draw a line ctx.strokeStyle = '#0000FF'; // Blue color ctx.lineWidth = 3; ctx.beginPath(); ctx.moveTo(0, 0); ctx.lineTo(800, 600); ctx.stroke();
MDN: Canvas 2D Context - All drawing methods

steps.title: Coordinate Systems & Transformations
steps.content:
Canvas coordinate system:

Origin (0,0) is at top-left
â€¢ X increases to the right
â€¢ Y increases downward

Canvas is like a grid: (column, row)

Transform to change drawing position:

// Save the current drawing state ctx.save(); // Move the origin (translate) ctx.translate(400, 300); // Draw at new origin ctx.fillStyle = '#FF00FF'; ctx.fillRect(-25, -25, 50, 50); // Rotate around origin ctx.rotate(Math.PI / 4); // 45 degrees ctx.fillStyle = '#FFFF00'; ctx.fillRect(-25, -25, 50, 50); // Scale ctx.scale(2, 2); ctx.fillStyle = '#00FFFF'; ctx.fillRect(-25, -25, 50, 50); // Restore original state ctx.restore();
MDN: Canvas translate() - Move origin point

steps.title: Drawing Text & Styling
steps.content:
Add text labels to your drawings:

// Set text properties ctx.font = '24px Arial'; ctx.fillStyle = '#FFFFFF'; ctx.textAlign = 'center'; ctx.textBaseline = 'middle'; // Draw text at position (x, y) ctx.fillText('Market Price', 400, 50); // Draw with outline ctx.strokeStyle = '#000000'; ctx.lineWidth = 2; ctx.strokeText('Iron Ore: $150', 400, 100); // Measure text width const metrics = ctx.measureText('$150'); console.log('Text width: ' + metrics.width);

Styling with gradients:

// Create a linear gradient const gradient = ctx.createLinearGradient(0, 0, 800, 0); gradient.addColorStop(0, '#FF0000'); // Red at left gradient.addColorStop(0.5, '#FFFF00'); // Yellow in middle gradient.addColorStop(1, '#00FF00'); // Green at right ctx.fillStyle = gradient; ctx.fillRect(0, 0, 800, 600);
MDN: Canvas font - Text styling
